intro: Antiaropsis decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive antiaropsis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. It produces small, round fruits that are covered in a thick, waxy coating. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
